All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AssetSetter
The AssetSetter class is responsible for placing NPCs and other assets in the game world at specific locations.
Battle
The Battle class represents a PokÃ©mon battle between two trainers.
BattleObserver
Interface for observing the end of a battle.
BattlePanel
The BattlePanel class represents the main panel where the battle interface is displayed.
Bulbasaur
Represents the Pokemon Bulbasaur.
Charmander
Represents the Pokemon Charmander.
ChoosePanel
The ChoosePanel class is a custom JPanel that displays buttons for selecting moves and PokÃ©mon to change.
CollisionChecker
The CollisionChecker class detects collisions between entities and tiles, ensuring that the player or NPCs cannot pass through solid objects.
Constants
The Costanti class contains constants used throughout the battle graphics.
Entity
The Entity class is designed to draw and manage both the characters' peculiarities; for example their phisical dimensions, their hitboxes, their dialogues etc.
Evolution
Represents the evolution details of a Pokemon, including its name and the level at which it evolves.
GameInfo
GameInfo is a custom JPanel that displays information about the chosen profile and the trainers' wins.
GameLogic
Manages the game logic for a battle between two trainers and their Pokemon.
GameObserver
Interface for observing updates in the game.
GamePanel
GamePanel is the core component of the game, handling rendering, updating, game states, collision checks, and transitions between different scenes like battles.
JLayeredTextPanel
The JLayeredTextPanel class manages different panels for displaying text, choosing moves, and learning new moves during a battle.
KeyHandler
The KeyHandler class is created to handle the different game states.
LearnMoveButtonListener
This class handles the action of a trainer learning a new move.
LearnMovePanel
The LearnMovePanel class is a custom JPanel that allows a pokemon to learn a new move.
Main
Main class that starts the JPokeBattle game.
MoveButtonListener
This class handles the action of a trainer's PokÃ©mon using a move during a battle.
MoveEffects
This class manages the effects of moves used in battles between Pokemon.
NPC_Opponent
The NPC_Opponent class represents an opponent NPC in the game.
Player
The Player class represents the main player character in the game, handling movement, interactions, animations, and input controls.
Pokemon
This class represents a PokÃ©mon with its attributes and methods for battle mechanics.
PokemonButtonListener
This class implements the ActionListener interface to handle events when a PokÃ©mon button is clicked.
PokemonImageMapper
The PokemonImageMapper class provides a mapping between PokÃ©mon names and their corresponding image numbers.
PokemonImagePanel
PokemonImagePanel is a custom JPanel that displays a PokÃ©mon image.
PokemonStatsPanel
PokemonStatsPanel is a custom JPanel that displays a PokÃ©mon's stats.
ShiftSpecifier
ShiftSpecifier is a custom JPanel that displays the trainer's name and the turn message.
Sound
The Sound class manages sound effects and music playback by using some .wav files
Squirtle
Represents the Pokemon Squirtle.
TextPanel
The TextPanel class is a custom JPanel that displays two lines of text with icons.
Tile
The Tile class represents a single tile in the game with an image and an optional collision property.
TileManager
The TileManager class handles tile management, including loading tile images, setting up tile properties, loading the map layout from a file, and drawing tiles on the screen based on the player's position.
Trainer
The Trainer class represents a PokÃ©mon trainer with a team of PokÃ©mon, a name, and a trainer level.
Type
 
TypeEV
The TypeEV enum represents the different types of Effort Values (EVs) that a PokÃ©mon can gain.
UI
The UI class handles rendering the game's user interface, including title, dialogue, end, and profile screens.
UtilityTool
The UtilityTool class provides utility methods for image manipulation, such as scaling images to specified dimensions.
